titles.en: THE BOOK OF OATHS, AND THE VOWS, AND THE EXPIATIONS

titles.ar: باب أَنَّهُ لَا يَحْلِفُ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا عَلَى عِلْمِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 11 – The man must not swear an oath except upon what is in his knowledge

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: صحيح - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (24/323)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا يَحْلِفُ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا عَلَى عِلْمِهِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Hisham Bin Salim,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The man must not swear an oath except based upon his knowledge’.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Ahmad ibn Muhammad from Ali ibn al-Hakam from Hisham ibn Salim who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘A man must not take an oath except for what he knows. 5 ”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (24/323)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْمُغِيرَةِ عَنْ خَالِدِ بْنِ أَيْمَنَ الْحَنَّاطِ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا يُسْتَحْلَفُ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا عَلَى عِلْمِهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Abdullah Bin Al Mugheira, from Khalid Bin Ayman Al Hannat, from Abu Baseer,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The man must not be made to swear except what is based upon his knowledge’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Abd Allah ibn al-Mughirah from Khalid ibn Ayman al-Hannat from abu Basir who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘A man must not be asked to take an oath except for what he knows.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (24/324)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا يَحْلِفُ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا عَلَى عِلْمِهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Salim,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The man must not swear except based upon his knowledge’.
en.sarwar: 3. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘ Umayr from Hisham ibn Salim who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘A man must not be asked to take an oath except for what he knows.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (4/324)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مَرَّارٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: لَا يُسْتَحْلَفُ الرَّجُلُ إِلَّا عَلَى عِلْمِهِ وَ لَا يَقَعُ الْيَمِينُ إِلَّا عَلَى الْعِلْمِ اسْتُحْلِفَ أَوْ لَمْ يُسْتَحْلَفْ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ismail Bin Marrar, from Yunus, fro one of his companions,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The man must not be made to swear except based upon his knowledge, and the oath would not take place except upon the knowledge, whether he has been made to swear or not made to swear’.
en.sarwar: 4. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ’Isma‘il ibn Marrar from Yunus from certain persons of his people who has narrated the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘A man must not be asked to take an oath except for what he knows and that oath applies only to what he knows, regardless, one is asked to swear or not’”
